title: Variance of Continuous Random Variables
contentHtml: In probability theory, we often encounter continuous random variables (RVs). The variance of such a variable is crucial in understanding its spread and uncertainty.

problem.statementHtml: Find the variance of a continuous RV X with probability density function (PDF) f_X(x) = 2e^{-2x} for x ≥ 0.
hints: Hint: Use the given PDF to set up an integral.
Hint: Simplify the integral by recognizing a familiar function.
problem.solutionHtml:
Step 1: Set up the integral using the formula.\[ \text{Var}(X) = \int_{0}^{\infty} (x - E[X])^2 f_X(x) dx \]

Step 2: Evaluate the expected value of X.\[ E[X] = \int_{0}^{\infty} x f_X(x) dx \]

Step 3: Substitute the result from Step 2 into the integral in Step 1.\[ \text{Var}(X) = \int_{0}^{\infty} (x - E[X])^2 f_X(x) dx \]
